header.title: How-to create a forrest table in Excel

section.title: Create your table in Excel
section.p: Follow these steps to create a new table in Excel:

ol.li: Set the document title in File→Properties...
Set the sheet's title as section title; Put each table in a separate sheet
Create a table header in the first row
Insert your content into the table
Set the output format to XML: File→Save as..., then select File type XML
Choose a filename that ends in -table.xml and save

section.p: You may open the XML file directly with Excel afterwards.
See the Simple Table as an example.

section.title: Include your table in forrest
section.p: Follow these steps to include a new table in your project:

ol.li: In your forrest.properties file: Include org.apache.forrest.plugin.excel in project.required.plugins
Include the file in your site.xml as usual: <mytable label="My Table" href="my-table.xml"/>

section.note: The plugin will treat all files ending in -table.xml as Excel-XML files.

section.title: Including figures
section.p: If you want to include a figure above your table, put the keyword figure into the first column and the path into the second column (relative to images). You may include a caption in the fourth (4th) column. See the Table with figure as an example.

section.title: Descriptive Text
section.p: If you want to include a descriptive text for a section, put the keyword text into the first column and the text itself into the second column. You may include more than one paragraph.

section.title: Coloring cells
section.p: For a color table you may specify the background color for single cells: put the color's hex-triplet (e.g. #FFD0AA) into the cell. Make sure this is the only content. See the Color Table as an example.
